summary.para: Obtains a message from the message queue and does not return until a message is obtained. This is the ANSI version of this method.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives message data.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle to the window whose messages are obtained. The window must belong to the current thread. If this value is NULL, this method obtains messages for any window that belongs to the calling thread.

param.name: wMsgFilterMin
param.para: Specifies the lowest message value obtained.

param.name: wMsgFilterMax
param.para: Specifies the highest message value obtained.

param.name: pfResult
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL value that receives the return value from the GetMessage function.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: If wMsgFilterMin and wMsgFilterMax are both zero, this method returns all available messages; that is, no range filtering is performed.

summary.para: Obtains a message from the message queue and does not return until a message is obtained. This is the Unicode version of this method.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives message data.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle to the window whose messages are obtained. The window must belong to the current thread. If this value is NULL, this method obtains messages for any window owned by the calling thread.

param.name: wMsgFilterMin
param.para: Specifies the lowest message value to obtain.

param.name: wMsgFilterMax
param.para: Specifies the highest message value to obtain.

param.name: pfResult
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that receives the return value from the GetMessage function.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: If wMsgFilterMin and wMsgFilterMax are both zero, this method returns all available messages; that is, no range filtering is performed.

summary.para: Obtains a message from the message queue and returns if no message is obtained. This is the ANSI version of this method.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives message data.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle to the window whose messages are obtained. The window must belong to the current thread. If this value is NULL, this method obtains messages for any window owned by the calling thread.

param.name: wMsgFilterMin
param.para: Specifies the lowest message value to obtain.

param.name: wMsgFilterMax
param.para: Specifies the highest message value to obtain.

param.name: wRemoveMsg
param.para: Specifies how messages are handled. For more information, see the PeekMessage function.

param.name: pfResult
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that receives the return value from the PeekMessage function.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: If wMsgFilterMin and wMsgFilterMax are both zero, this method returns all available messages; that is, no range filtering is performed.

summary.para: Obtains a message from the message queue and returns if no message is obtained. This is the Unicode version of this method.

param.name: pMsg
param.para: Pointer to a structure that receives message data.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle to the window whose messages are obtained. The window must belong to the current thread. If this value is NULL, this method obtains messages for any window that belongs to the calling thread.

param.name: wMsgFilterMin
param.para: Specifies the lowest message value to obtain.

param.name: wMsgFilterMax
param.para: Specifies the highest message value to obtain.

param.name: wRemoveMsg
param.para: Specifies how messages are handled. For more information, see the PeekMessage function.

param.name: pfResult
param.para: Pointer to a BOOL that receives the return value from the PeekMessage function.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: If wMsgFilterMin and wMsgFilterMax are both zero, this method returns all available messages; that is, no range filtering is performed.

summary.para: The ITfMessagePump interface is implemented by the TSF manager and is used by an application to obtain messages from the application message queue. The methods of this interface are wrappers for the GetMessage and functions. This interface enables the TSF manager to perform any necessary pre-message or post-message processing.

remarks.para: If the application is Unicode, it should use the PeekMessageW and GetMessageW methods. Otherwise, the application should use the PeekMessageA and GetMessageA methods.
